snippet: A military tribunal at the Guantánamo Bay detention camp is the wrong system, and the wrong place, to try the mastermind of the 9/11 attacks.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the Pentagon's prosecutors for referring the case against Khalid Shaikh Mohammed and four other men for their role in the September 11, 2001, attacks to a military tribunal that will be convened at the Guantanamo Bay Naval Base prison facility; asserts that military tribunals are the worst way to administer justice to the 9/11 terrorists, and the choice of Guantanamo Bay as a venue is ill-advised, given that it is a global symbol of human rights abuses.
lead_paragraph: A military tribunal at the Guantánamo Bay detention camp is the wrong system, and the wrong place, to try the mastermind of the 9/11 attacks.

headline.seo: The Road We Need Not Have Traveled
headline.main: The Road We Need Not Have Traveled
headline.print_headline: The Road We Need Not Have Traveled
